DOC.brief_summary: Background : Maternal obesity associate high risk adverse maternal fetal complication , effect dietary lifestyle intervention gestational weight gain ( GWG ) pregnancy outcomes obese pregnant woman unclear . Objective : This study examine whether intensive dietary lifestyle intervention initiate early pregnancy could decrease GWG , prevent relevant adverse pregnancy outcomes Chinese obese pregnant woman . Design : A randomized control trial obese pregnant woman perform 6-12 week gestation.The sample size estimate use GWG reduction primary outcome variable . The investigator pilot study ( data publish ) show gestational weight gain 12.73±5.97 obese woman . Assuming intervention may result 25 % ( 3.1825g ) reduction GWG , estimate sample size 90 % power type I error 0.05 114 woman intervention group 57 control group . Adjusting 15 % refusal loss follow pregnancy , total sample size require 136 woman intervention group 68 control group ( standard care group ) . Participants randomly assign control intervention group . The intervention focus restrict energy intake combine behavioral lifestyle modification participation group session individual counseling . The primary outcome gestational weight gain ( GWG ) secondary outcome incidence gestational diabetes mellitus ( GDM ) , hypertensive disorder pregnancy , large-for-gestational-age ( LGA ) infant , macrosomia rate caesarian section . Hypothesis : The intensive dietary lifestyle intervention perform first trimester obese woman could decrease total GWG , perhaps improve relevant pregnancy outcome .
